adjective.description: Given, felt, or done in return.
examples: she was hoping for some reciprocal comment or gesture

adjective.description: (of an agreement or obligation) bearing on or binding each of two parties equally.
examples: the treaty is a bilateral commitment with reciprocal rights and duties

adjective.description: (of a course or bearing) differing from a given course or bearing by 180 degrees.
(of a quantity or function) related to another so that their product is one.

noun.description: A mathematical expression or function so related to another that their product is one; the quantity obtained by dividing the number one by a given quantity.
A pronoun or verb expressing mutual action or relationship, e.g. each other, fight.

origin: Late 16th century: from Latin reciprocus (based on re- back + pro- forward) + -al.
